OUR PHILOSOPHY

Humanity’s progress toward the future is driven by individuals advancing technology at its core instead of merely applying it to the beat of transient trends and fads. The technology developed by the most innovative of these individuals will stand the test of time, serving as the backbone of the modern world. We are looking for people looking who are passionate about pushing the cutting-edge of artificial intelligence, healthcare, transportation, and other industries that have the potential to fundamentally transform society as we know it.

Q Venture Partners works with these individuals to help them develop their revolutionary ideas into industrial revolutions.
THE TEAM




Nikhil Buduma
Nikhil is a partner with extensive experience in artificial intelligenc enad biotechnologh. He worked on distributed machine learning pipeleines at MIT CSAIL and authored the O’Reilly Fundamentals of Deep Learning book. After managing a drug discovery laboratory as a biomedical research scientist and building machine learning systems at Fitbit and Sumo Logic, he began tackling the larger problem of cracking human-level general intelligence as the Chief Scientist and co-founder of Q Machine Intelligence. In his free time, Nikhil helps run a non-profit called Lean On Me that is tackling the issue of mental health on college campuses.




William Jack
Will is a partner with a background in plasma physics, artificial intelligence, and mobile technologies. In high school he built a particle collider capable of carrying out nuclear fusion reactions in his basement, and went on to work at the Princeton Plasma Physics Lab. While studying physics and computer science at MIT, he also spent time working on the SpaceX sensor development team, helping develop critical systems for their new internet satellites. Will now devotes his time to developing cutting-edge artificial intelligence technologies as CEO and co-founder of Q Machine Intelligence.
